title: Magnitude of change of momentum of collision

content.description:
Scenario Number Final Velocity of Cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="negative v sub x 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="v sub y 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> 

Cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> travels along a horizontal surface with a constant speed in the positive horizontal direction. Cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> then collides with cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of mass <math alttext="M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, which was initially at rest. After the collision, cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> has a positive velocity. Immediately after the collision, cart <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and cart <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> could have one of three final velocities that are indicated in the table. In all scenarios, the total momentum of the two-cart system is the same before and after the collision.
content.question: Assume that the collision in each scenario is elastic. How does the magnitude of the change in the momentum <math alttext="Delta p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mtext></mtext><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of Object <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> compare for each scenario?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta p sub 1 is greater than delta p sub 2, which is greater than delta p sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="delta p sub 1 is greater than delta p sub 3, which is greater than delta p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta p sub 3 is greater than delta p sub 2, which is greater than delta p sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta p sub 3 is greater than delta p sub 1, which is greater than delta p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta p sub 3 is greater than delta p sub 1, which is greater than delta p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
